page.title: 07Methodism in Hunton
page.content: {Hunton Methodist Chapel There has been "a constant Christian witness" on this site since 1829. The chapel is in the {Richmond circuit.}At present there are 14 members, but the average Sunday morning attendance is about eight. The Harvest Festival is the main annual event and aids in fund raising. United services are also held monthly with St.John's congregation. There is no Sunday school now, but an inter-denominational group of Mums run a{Thursday Club}for young children in the chapel school room. Twelve of us are divided into two groups.We sing songs,have a Bible reading,do quizzes, hear a story and draw pictures. We end the meeting in a ring and say prayers. The{local Ladies' Choir}practices in the chapel on Wednesday evenings. They provide enjoyable entertainment at functions around our area.
